docs.text: Peter Luro Personal Microsite About Me My name is Peter Luro and I am a passionate software engineer with 3 years of professional experience in the field. I have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science from WPI and have worked with a variety of programming languages including Python, SQL, C, C++, Java, JavaScript, React, Swagger (YAML), CSS & HTML. Throughout my career, I have had the opportunity to work on a range of exciting projects, from building mobile applications to developing complex enterprise-level software solutions. I pride myself on my ability to work well under pressure, meet tight deadlines, and deliver high-quality code that is both efficient and maintainable. In my free time, I enjoy scripting useful functionality for my day trading side hobby. I have also tested completely automated day trading, using recommendations from various sources attained by Python GET requests. If you're interested in learning more about my work or have a project in mind that you think I could help with, please don't hesitate to reach out to me. I'm always excited to collaborate with new people and tackle new challenges! Education Worcester Polytechnic Institute (WPI) Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, GPA: 3.65/4.0

docs.title: Education

docs.text: Optum Scheduled Docker Vulnerability Alerting Configured a Jenkins pipeline to build and test all of the organization’s project Dockerfiles for vulnerabilities on a daily scheduled check. Dockerfiles built through a configuration json, submitted through a second Jenkins pipeline, then the images pushed to Azure ACR to be scanned by theure Defender. Vulnerability scores are then accessed Azure GraphQuery and ownrer's of Dockerfiles with high vulnerability scores are notified via email. The email also contains remediation guidelines on how to resolve the vulnerabilities found. Internships Kibana visualization dashboards for Medical claim analytics on UHG payments. First place winner of the Boston Global Hackathon and placed second nationally. Developed a mobaile application which would incentivize youth to follow healthy daily routines. Additional Projects Python Trading App - configured daily alerts identifying high probability setups in stock price fluctuations from morning recommendations that are pulled from various sources using Python GET requests. Real time stock price data is gathered by yfinance Python library and sms notifications are sent through Twilio texting API identifying potential breakouts.
docs.title: Projects
